commit_message:
Load several fixtures when tesing

This patch makes it possible to load several fixtures
into nailgun database before starting tests.
One can use NAILGUN_FIXTURE_FILES variable.
It is to be a space separated list of files that
are then to be used together with 'manage.py loaddata'
command.

Change-Id: I483399b57d065934aea1118040da378988d89e9d
Closes-Bug: #1540421
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/07/274707/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NAILGUN_FIXTURE_FILES=
deleted_lines: NAILGUN_SAMPLE_FILE={toxinidir}/nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/sample_environment.json NAILGUN_SAMPLE_LOAD=no

commit_message:
zuul/layout: optimize puppet jobs

This patch aims to optimize the consumtion of OpenStack Infra for Puppet
OpenStack jobs.

It will avoid to run some jobs if we're just patching *.md files or
releasenotes managed by reno.

Here are the job we want to skip:
* gate-puppet-.*-puppet-syntax-.*-dsvm-.*
* gate-puppet-.*-puppet-unit-.*-dsvm-.*
* gate-puppet-.*-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-.*
* gate-puppet-openstack-integration-scenario00(1|2)-tempest-dsvm-.*

Which are syntax, unit & functional testing jobs.

It will save a lot of resources when we just want to update releasenotes
or doc.

Change-Id: I300abb47259a6fa9acdcfbc3e2eb15f9c3fea69b

commit_message:
Fix handling of endpoint directory deletion

The on_dir_delete method needs to handle keyword args, as that's how
the dispatcher will actually call it.

Change-Id: I7e17f59a964c67f61332e977f83bf30f442b1fe0
Closes-Bug: #1540524
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/39/274839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def on_dir_delete(self, response, *args, **kwargs): " resync; %s %s %s", response, args, kwargs) # Handle by doing a resync.
deleted_lines: def on_dir_delete(self, response, *args): " resync; %s %s", response, args) # Unexpected, so handle by doing a resync.

commit_message:
Add growroot element to Fedora 23

This element is required to grow the root partition to fill the disk.
Currently devstack/f23 jobs fail with an out-of-disk error

Change-Id: I27ef2525a1c5b2230d22807d0d47bf19115c8f66
Depends-On: I5630dc638f85b1e80795826ef36a306632075460

commit_message:
[config-ref] Add Fujitsu ETERNUS DX driver

Add an article about Fujitsu ETERNUS DX driver in volume driver page.

Change-Id: I5405212668e52db2306aee47f4d6cb91f0d566cd
Closes-Bug: #1531165
Closes-Bug: #1535691
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/83/265683/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================= Fujitsu ETERNUS DX driver ========================= Fujitsu ETERNUS DX driver provides iSCSI support for ETERNUS DX S3 series. The driver performs volume operations by communicating with ETERNUS DX. It uses a CIM client in Python called PyWBEM to perform CIM operations over HTTP. For storage pool for volumes, RAID Group and Thin Provisioning Pool (TPP) in ETERNUS DX can be specified. System requirements ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Supported storages: * ETERNUS DX60 S3 * ETERNUS DX100 S3/DX200 S3 * ETERNUS DX500 S3/DX600 S3 * ETERNUS DX8700 S3/DX8900 S3 * ETERNUS DX200F Requirements: * Firmware version V10L30 or later is required. * The multipath environment with ETERNUS Multipath Driver is unsupported. * An Advanced Copy Feature license is required to create a snapshot and a clone. Supported operations ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Create, delete, attach, and detach volumes. * Create, list, and delete volume snapshots. * Create a volume from a snapshot. * Copy an image to a volume. * Copy a volume to an image. * Clone a volume. * Extend a volume. (\*1) * Get volume statistics. (\*1): It is excecutable only when TPP is specified for storage pool. Preparation ~~~~~~~~~~~ Package Installation -------------------- Install the ``python-pywbem`` package for your distribution. * On Ubuntu: .. code-block:: console # apt-get install python-pywbem * On openSUSE: .. code-block:: console # zypper install python-pywbem * On Red Hat Enterprise Linux, CentOS, and Fedora: .. code-block:: console # yum install pywbem ETERNUS DX Setup ---------------- Set up ETERNUS DX using ETRENUS Web GUI or CLI. For detailed operations, refer the ETERNUS Web GUI user's guide or ETERNUS CLI user's guide for ETERNUS DX S3 series. The following steps requires to be done by the account which has Admin role. #. Create an account for communication between Cinder controller. #. Enable the SMI-S of ETERNUS DX. #. Register an Advanced Copy Feature license and configure copy table size. #. Create a storage pool for volumes. #. If necessary (\*2), create a storage pool for snapshots. #. Create Snap Data Pool Volume (SDPV) to enable Snap Data Pool (SDP) for "``create a snapshot``". #. Configure storage ports used for OpenStack. - Set CA mode to those storage ports. - Enable the host-affinity settings of those storage ports. (ETERNUS CLI command to enable host-affinity settings): .. code-block:: console CLI> set iscsi-parameters -host-affinity enable -port <CM#><CA#><Port#> #. Ensure LAN connection between Cinder controller and MNT port of ETERNUS DX and SAN connection between Compute nodes and CA ports of ETERNUS DX. (\*2): If you want to create snapshots on a storage pool for volumes, this is unnecessary. Configuration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ #. Create driver configuration files. Make XML file as driver configuration file and add configure as below: .. code-block:: xml <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <FUJITSU> <EternusIP>0.0.0.0</EternusIP> <EternusPort>5988</EternusPort> <EternusUser>smisuser</EternusUser> <EternusPassword>smispassword</EternusPassword> <EternusPool>raid5_0001</EternusPool> <EternusSnapPool>raid5_0001</EternusSnapPool> <EternusISCSIIP>1.1.1.1</EternusISCSIIP> <EternusISCSIIP>1.1.1.2</EternusISCSIIP> <EternusISCSIIP>1.1.1.3</EternusISCSIIP> <EternusISCSIIP>1.1.1.4</EternusISCSIIP> </FUJITSU> Where: ``EternusIP`` IP address for the SMI-S connection of the ETRENUS DX. Enter the IP address of MNT port of the ETERNUS DX. ``EternusPort`` Port number for the SMI-S connection port of the ETERNUS DX. ``EternusUser`` User name for the SMI-S connection of the ETERNUS DX. ``EternusPassword`` Password for the SMI-S connection of the ETERNUS DX. ``EternusPool`` Storage pool name for volumes. Enter RAID Group name or TPP name in the ETERNUS DX. ``EternusSnapPool`` Storage pool name for snapshots. Enter RAID Group name in the ETERNUS DX. ``EternusISCSIIP`` (Multiple setting allowed) iSCSI connection IP address of the ETERNUS DX. .. note:: * Same RAID Group name can be specified for ``EternusPool`` and ``EternusSnapPool`` if volumes and snapshots are created on same storage pool. * For ``EternusSnapPool``, only RAID Group name can be specified. TPP name cannot be specified for the parameter. #. Configure cinder.conf. Add the following entries to ``/etc/cinder/cinder.conf``: .. code-block:: ini [DEFAULT] enabled_backends = DXISCSI1, DXISCSI2 [DXISCSI1] volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.fujitsu.eternus_dx_iscsi.FJDXISCSIDriver cinder_eternus_config_file = /etc/cinder/sample1.xml volume_backend_name = ISCSI1 [DXISCSI2] volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.fujitsu.eternus_dx_iscsi.FJDXISCSIDriver cinder_eternus_config_file = /etc/cinder/sample2.xml volume_backend_name = ISCSI2 In this example, two backends are enabled: ``DXISCSI1`` and ``DXISCSI2``. The parameters for these backends are written in driver conifiguration file ``sample1.xml`` and ``sample2.xml``, which are specified by ``cinder_eternus_config_file``. When ``cinder_eternus_config_file`` is not specified, it is set default value "``/etc/cinder/cinder_fujitsu_eternus_dx.xml``" to. #. Create volume type and set extra specs to the type. Create volume type with ``volume_backend_name`` using cinderclient or openstackclient. With cinderclient: .. code-block:: console $ cinder type-create DX_ISCSI1 $ cinder type-key DX_ISCSI1 set volume_backend_name=ISCSI1 $ cinder type-create DX_ISCSI2 $ cinder type-key DX_ISCSI2 set volume_backend_name=ISCSI2 With openstackclient: .. code-block:: console $ openstack volume type create \ --property volume_backend_name=ISCSI1 DX_ISCSI1 $ openstack volume type create \ --property volume_backend_name=ISCSI2 DX_ISCSI2 By issuing these commands, the volume type ``DX_ISCSI1`` is associated with the ``ISCSI1``, and the type ``DX_ISCSI2`` is associated with the ``ISCSI2``.

commit_message:
Move port creation/deletion testing to its own class

Change-Id: I980c71284c33f9ef64f27b3119e3b2f00a866420
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/20/275020/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class PortTestWrapper(object): def __init__(self, neutron, nb_api, network_id=None): self.neutron = neutron self.nb_api = nb_api self.network_id = network_id self.port_id = None def create(self, port=None): if not port: port = { 'admin_state_up': True, 'name': 'port1', 'network_id': self.network_id, } port = self.neutron.create_port(body={'port': port}) self.port_id = port['port']['id'] return self.port_id def get_logical_port(self): return self.nb_api.get_logical_port(self.port_id) def exists(self): port = self.get_logical_port() if port: return True return False def delete(self): self.neutron.delete_port(self.port_id)

commit_message:
[Core-Library] Fix the way of getting DNS in describe() method

This patch changes the method of getting dns address.
Previously dns could be an empty list, if user didn't configured
'default_dns' settings in murano.conf. Now it is taken from already
created subnet.

Change-Id: I5c6a831738e8d971a12bd81eff42aebc869c9a2e
Related-Bug: #1536651
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/56/273156/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: dns: $._netExplorer.getDefaultDns()

commit_message:
devstack: support publicURL retrieval in both keystone v2/v3 format

Recent devstack commit Ia792b23119c00089542ba08879dca1c29dc80945 revert
keystone to use V2 api again, we need to support both v2/v3 output
format.

Change-Id: I7885633a84ca70f20a060fbefe3021ad7f79c910

commit_message:
Fix tempauth support

This patch makes storlet_runtime to handle account names in
tempauth style which look like AUTH_(account name) properly,
and make Storlets support tempauth for its auth mechanism.

Change-Id: Idfd3ce513e8f2f36c75f058cacbb60e98bb62dd9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/50/265150/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: storlet_conf['reseller_prefix'] = conf.get('resellter_prefix', 'AUTH')

subject: Remove direct copying default settings.yaml to astute.yaml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-01 13:23:46.000000000', 'files': ['specs/fuelmenu.spec'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-menu/commit/15bdbceb4485e058737e56b4e30966791ad55976', 'message': 'Remove direct copying default settings.yaml to astute.yaml

  The astute.yaml should be generated from settings.yaml
  using fuelmenu. Without this change astute.yaml contains

commit_message:
Remove direct copying default settings.yaml to astute.yaml

  The astute.yaml should be generated from settings.yaml
  using fuelmenu. Without this change astute.yaml contains
  incorrect values if fuelmenu fails.

Change-Id: I5c0885c8991bc41cce5396e3c587f466ef0d3f92
Related-Bug: #1534517
(cherry picked from commit 8fe1220566487079869c4815a59dd4804a8af2c9)

commit_message:
Add new OVS test for DHCP application pipeline

Change-Id: If23519f39a8ebd308c968847355c4aaa73a23e45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/48/273548/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from dragonflow.tests.fullstack import test_base from dragonflow.tests.fullstack import test_objects as objects import time DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT = 5 class TestOVSFlowsForDHCP(test_base.DFTestBase): def setUp(self): super(TestOVSFlowsForDHCP, self).setUp() def check_dhcp_rule(self, flows, dhcp_srv): for flow in flows: if flow['table'] == '9,' and flow['actions'] == 'goto_table:11': if ('nw_dst=' + dhcp_srv + ',tp_src=68,tp_dst=67' in flow['match']): return True return False def test_broadcast_dhcp_rule(self): ovs = objects.OvsTestWarapper() flows = ovs.dump() for flow in flows: if flow['table'] == '9,' and flow['actions'] == 'goto_table:11': if ('udp,dl_dst=ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff,tp_src=68,tp_dst=67' in flow['match']): return self.assertEqual('no_default_dhcp_rule', 0) def test_create_update_subnet_with_dhcp(self): ovs = objects.OvsTestWarapper() flows1 = ovs.dump() network = objects.NetworkTestWrapper(self.neutron, self.nb_api) network_id = network.create() subnet = {'network_id': network_id, 'cidr': '10.10.0.0/24', 'gateway_ip': '10.10.0.1', 'ip_version': 4, 'name': 'subnet-test', 'enable_dhcp': True} subnet2 = self.neutron.create_subnet({'subnet': subnet}) subnet_id = subnet2['subnet']['id'] ports = self.neutron.list_ports(network_id=network_id) ports = ports['ports'] dhcp_ip = False for port in ports: if port['device_owner'] == 'network:dhcp': ips = port['fixed_ips'] for ip in ips: if ip['subnet_id'] == subnet_id: dhcp_ip = ip['ip_address'] self.assertTrue(dhcp_ip) time.sleep(DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT) flows2 = ovs.dump() self.assertFalse(self.check_dhcp_rule(flows1, dhcp_ip)) self.assertTrue(self.check_dhcp_rule(flows2, dhcp_ip)) # change dhcp subnet3 = {'enable_dhcp': False} self.neutron.update_subnet(subnet_id, {'subnet': subnet3}) time.sleep(DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT) flows3 = ovs.dump() self.assertFalse(self.check_dhcp_rule(flows3, dhcp_ip)) network.delete() def test_create_update_subnet_without_dhcp(self): ovs = objects.OvsTestWarapper() flows1 = ovs.dump() network = objects.NetworkTestWrapper(self.neutron, self.nb_api) network_id = network.create() subnet = {'network_id': network_id, 'cidr': '10.20.0.0/24', 'gateway_ip': '10.20.0.1', 'ip_version': 4, 'name': 'subnet-test', 'enable_dhcp': False} subnet2 = self.neutron.create_subnet({'subnet': subnet}) subnet_id = subnet2['subnet']['id'] time.sleep(DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT) flows2 = ovs.dump() # change dhcp subnet3 = {'enable_dhcp': True} self.neutron.update_subnet(subnet_id, {'subnet': subnet3}) ports = self.neutron.list_ports(network_id=network_id) ports = ports['ports'] dhcp_ip = False for port in ports: if port['device_owner'] == 'network:dhcp': ips = port['fixed_ips'] for ip in ips: if ip['subnet_id'] == subnet_id: dhcp_ip = ip['ip_address'] self.assertTrue(dhcp_ip) self.assertFalse(self.check_dhcp_rule(flows1, dhcp_ip)) self.assertFalse(self.check_dhcp_rule(flows2, dhcp_ip)) time.sleep(DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT) flows3 = ovs.dump() self.assertTrue(self.check_dhcp_rule(flows3, dhcp_ip)) network.delete() time.sleep(DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT) flows4 = ovs.dump() self.assertFalse(self.check_dhcp_rule(flows4, dhcp_ip)) def test_create_router_interface(self): ovs = objects.OvsTestWarapper() flows1 = ovs.dump() router = objects.RouterTestWrapper(self.neutron, self.nb_api) network = objects.NetworkTestWrapper(self.neutron, self.nb_api) network_id = network.create() subnet = {'network_id': network_id, 'cidr': '10.30.0.0/24', 'gateway_ip': '10.30.0.1', 'ip_version': 4, 'name': 'subnet-test', 'enable_dhcp': True} subnet = self.neutron.create_subnet({'subnet': subnet}) subnet_id = subnet['subnet']['id'] router_id = router.create() self.assertTrue(router.exists()) subnet_msg = {'subnet_id': subnet_id} self.neutron.add_interface_router(router_id, body=subnet_msg) ports = self.neutron.list_ports(network_id=network_id) ports = ports['ports'] dhcp_ip = False for port in ports: if port['device_owner'] == 'network:dhcp': ips = port['fixed_ips'] for ip in ips: if ip['subnet_id'] == subnet_id: dhcp_ip = ip['ip_address'] self.assertTrue(dhcp_ip) time.sleep(DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT) flows2 = ovs.dump() self.assertFalse(self.check_dhcp_rule(flows1, dhcp_ip)) self.assertTrue(self.check_dhcp_rule(flows2, dhcp_ip)) #diff = ovs.diff_flows(flows1, flows2) #for d in diff: # print d self.neutron.remove_interface_router(router_id, body=subnet_msg) router.delete() network.delete() time.sleep(DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT) flows3 = ovs.dump() self.assertFalse(self.check_dhcp_rule(flows3, dhcp_ip))

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/77/273877/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This spec describe the design of a topology distributing mechanism. It push topology info only to Dragonflow local controllers that need the info.Currently, Dragonflow local controller caches all the topology info, for example all the networks, ports and routers etc. In fact,one compute node only have dozens of virtual machines and topology info used by these VMs is merely a tiny part of the topology of the whole data center networks. Most of the info cached by Dragonflow local controller will never be used by the controller. Moreover, in order to keep all the cached topology info up to date, local controllers have to repeatedly communicate with the Dragonflow database. With the increase of compute nodes, communication of this type will also increase correspondingly. For Dragonflow local controllers, this method will cause high CPU and memory occupation rate. It's more disastrous to Dragonflow database, for there will be too many request from tens of thousands compute nodes for it to process.The idea is quite simple: each Dragonflow local controller subscribe topology info it's interested in from the sub-pub server. When topology changed, in addition to save it to the Dragonflow database, neutron plugin or Dragonflow local controller has to publish the change to the sub-pub server also. The sub-pub server then publishes the change to who that subscribe the change.Selective topology distribution depends on the sub-pub function which is shown in the following diagram. When there is a topology change, for example, new port created by a tenant, a publisher(in this case, the Dragonflow neutron plugin) will publish this event together with detailed info of the new port to a Topic. Every topic records a list of subscribers. On received a event from publisher, the topic will send the event to every subscribers in the list. For the port creating example, there may be many Dragonflow local controllers which have ports connecting to the same network with the new port. These local controllers care about changes of ports in the network and will subscribe change of this network by registering to the corresponding topic. These controllers will get notified by the topic when this new port is added.There are many type of topology change. In large scale data center, number of tenants is also considerable. There will be tons of topics if publish different events to different topics. The implementation will be too complex. Some degree of convergence have to be taken into accounted to simplify the situation. There are two way to converge the types of topology change.One tenant has only one topic. All kinds of change in topology of the tenant are sent to this topic.Subscriber will receive redundant event and store additional topology it will never use.Every vpc or router has it own topic. For isolated network which doesn't connect to any router, it also it own topic. Change in topology are published to the corresponding topic.Finer grained. When a tenant have many vpr or routers or isolated networks, Change in topology of different vpc or routers or networks will not affect each other.Harder for subscriber and publisher to decide which topic they should subscribe or publish.When a tenant named tenant1 create a port through neutron's northbound api, neutron's Dragonflow plugin will publish a event to tenant's topic in the sub/pub server. The sub/pub server will then check who have subscribed the topic and publish the event to them. On receiving the event, local controller will save the new port's information and install some flow entries on OVS which is not covered in this spec.In the above diagram, Dragonflow local controller 2 has no VMs belong to tenant1. It will not subscribe tenant1's topic and therefore will not get notified. Processing of other northbound topology change, such as creating, deleting or modifying router, network and port are same as the above example.When nova startup a VM on a host, it will insert a port on the corresponding OVS bridge. On knowing a new OVS port online, Dragonflow local controller queries port's topology from database and knows which tenant the port belongs to. After that, local controller will subscribe the tenant's topic.If nova remove a port from OVS bridge, local controller will check if it's the tenant's last port on the host. If it is, local controller will unsubscribe the tenant's topic and will not receive any further event of the tenant's topology change.

commit_message:
This spec is for selective proactive distribution.

Change-Id: Iac0169f8b5838d9ec224d8db47032f43c7a9c20a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/19/273019/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================== Selective Topology Distribution =============================== This spec describe the design of a topology distributing mechanism. It push topology info only to Dragonflow local controllers that need the info. Problem Description =================== Currently, Dragonflow local controller caches all the topology info, for example all the networks, ports and routers etc. In fact,one compute node only have dozens of virtual machines and topology info used by these VMs is merely a tiny part of the topology of the whole data center networks. Most of the info cached by Dragonflow local controller will never be used by the controller. Moreover, in order to keep all the cached topology info up to date, local controllers have to repeatedly communicate with the Dragonflow database. With the increase of compute nodes, communication of this type will also increase correspondingly. For Dragonflow local controllers, this method will cause high CPU and memory occupation rate. It's more disastrous to Dragonflow database, for there will be too many request from tens of thousands compute nodes for it to process. Proposed Change =============== basic idea ---------- The idea is quite simple: each Dragonflow local controller subscribe topology info it's interested in from the sub-pub server. When topology changed, in addition to save it to the Dragonflow database, neutron plugin or Dragonflow local controller has to publish the change to the sub-pub server also. The sub-pub server then publishes the change to who that subscribe the change. Publisher subscriber pattern ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Selective topology distribution depends on the sub-pub function which is shown in the following diagram. When there is a topology change, for example, new port created by a tenant, a publisher(in this case, the Dragonflow neutron plugin) will publish this event together with detailed info of the new port to a Topic. Every topic records a list of subscribers. On received a event from publisher, the topic will send the event to every subscribers in the list. For the port creating example, there may be many Dragonflow local controllers which have ports connecting to the same network with the new port. These local controllers care about changes of ports in the network and will subscribe change of this network by registering to the corresponding topic. These controllers will get notified by the topic when this new port is added. +--------------+ +---> Subscriber A | | +--------------+ | +---------+ | +----> Topic A +--+ +--------------+ +-----------+ | +---------+ +---> | | Publisher +---+ | Subscriber B | +-----------+ | +---------+ +---> | +----> Topic B +--+ +--------------+ +---------+ | | | +--------------+ +---> Subscriber C | +--------------+ Tow ways to distribute topology selectively ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ There are many type of topology change. In large scale data center, number of tenants is also considerable. There will be tons of topics if publish different events to different topics. The implementation will be too complex. Some degree of convergence have to be taken into accounted to simplify the situation. There are two way to converge the types of topology change. One topic per tenant """""""""""""""""""" One tenant has only one topic. All kinds of change in topology of the tenant are sent to this topic. **Pros** Easier for Publisher to decide which topic to public. Easier for Subscriber to decide which topic to subscribe. **Cons** Subscriber will receive redundant event and store additional topology it will never use. One topic per vpc or router """"""""""""""""""""""""""""""" Every vpc or router has it own topic. For isolated network which doesn't connect to any router, it also it own topic. Change in topology are published to the corresponding topic. **Pros** Finer grained. When a tenant have many vpr or routers or isolated networks, Change in topology of different vpc or routers or networks will not affect each other. **Cons** Harder for subscriber and publisher to decide which topic they should subscribe or publish. Here, I will only discuss the first way for simplicity. Detailed design --------------- Northbound Topology Change """""""""""""""""""""""""" When a tenant named tenant1 create a port through neutron's northbound api, neutron's Dragonflow plugin will publish a event to tenant's topic in the sub/pub server. The sub/pub server will then check who have subscribed the topic and publish the event to them. On receiving the event, local controller will save the new port's information and install some flow entries on OVS which is not covered in this spec. +----------------+ +----------------+ +------------------+ +------------------+ | neutron plugin | | sub/pub server | | Dragonflow local | | Dragonflow Local | +-------+--------+ +------+---------+ | Controller 1 | | Controller2 | | | +--------+---------+ +--------+---------+ | | | | | | | | | publish(tenant1)| | | +-----------------> | | | | publish(tenant1) | | | +--------------------> | | | | | | | | | + + + + In the above diagram, Dragonflow local controller 2 has no VMs belong to tenant1. It will not subscribe tenant1's topic and therefore will not get notified. Processing of other northbound topology change, such as creating, deleting or modifying router, network and port are same as the above example. Southbound Topology Change """""""""""""""""""""""""" When nova startup a VM on a host, it will insert a port on the corresponding OVS bridge. On knowing a new OVS port online, Dragonflow local controller queries port's topology from database and knows which tenant the port belongs to. After that, local controller will subscribe the tenant's topic. +----------------+ +------------------+ | sub/pub server | | Dragonflow local | +------+---------+ | Controller 1 | | +--------+---------+ | | | | | +----+ new OVS port | | | online | <----+ | | | Get port's topology | from database | | | subscribe(tenant1) | <--------------------+ | | | | + + If nova remove a port from OVS bridge, local controller will check if it's the tenant's last port on the host. If it is, local controller will unsubscribe the tenant's topic and will not receive any further event of the tenant's topology change.

commit_message:
Remove the test number of flow

This test was introduced as an example and assumes
that no other test run in parallel
New test were added and we have few in the pipeline

Change-Id: I1829fe71a2c42e76b743e358b534d70c9e312a5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/43/274743/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from neutron.agent.common import utils from dragonflow.tests.fullstack import test_base EXPECTED_NUMBER_OF_FLOWS_AFTER_GATE_DEVSTACK = 26 class TestOVSFlows(test_base.DFTestBase): def setUp(self): super(TestOVSFlows, self).setUp() def _get_ovs_flows(self): full_args = ["ovs-ofctl", "dump-flows", 'br-int', '-O Openflow13'] flows = utils.execute(full_args, run_as_root=True, process_input=None) return flows def test_number_of_flows(self): flows = self._get_ovs_flows() flow_list = flows.split("\n")[1:] flows_count = len(flow_list) - 1 self.assertEqual(flows_count, EXPECTED_NUMBER_OF_FLOWS_AFTER_GATE_DEVSTACK) def _parse_ovs_flows(self): flows = self._get_ovs_flows() flow_list = flows.split("\n")[1:] flows_as_dicts = [] for flow in flow_list: fs = flow.split(' ') res = {} res['table'] = fs[3].split('=')[1] res['match'] = fs[6] res['packets'] = fs[4].split('=')[1] res['actions'] = fs[7].split('=')[1] res['cookie'] = fs[1].split('=')[1] flows_as_dicts.append(res) return flows_as_dicts

commit_message:
Update translation setup

Follow new infra setup for translations, see spec
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack-infra/infra-specs/specs/translation_setup.html
for full details.

This basically renames
neutron-lib/locale/neutron-lib.pot to
neutron_lib/locale/neutron_lib.pot. For this we need to update
setup.cfg.

Update also domain name in _i18n.py.

The project has no translations currently, let's remove the outdated
pot file, the updated scripts work without them. So, we can just
delete the file and once there are translations, an updated pot file
together with translations can be imported automatically.

Change-Id: I73db7b37f5a44ae45c01ca16abccb41a5fbfbfe8

commit_message:
Remove duplicated take_action logging

This commit drops utils.log_method decorators.
As a result of logging refactoring in openstackclient [1],
utils.log_method decorator is no longer used in openstackclient
and we are planning to drop utils.log_method.

searchlightclient is the only project that uses log_method
decorator. take_action logging is duplicated, so we can safely
drop log_method decorator.

Once this patch is merged, openstackclient can drop utils.log_method
because there is no released searchlightclient.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bug/1532294

Change-Id: Ib94e7ba77262a9a8cbfce71f3083c47cb1973364
Related-Bug: #1532294
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-searchlightclient refs/changes/75/274975/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Limit keystone extension tests for the existing

Since Ifac71f7415f21c402f6e00c5264e972b0e80388c in Mitaka, the
os_inherit of Keystone is enable on the default config.
In addition, Tempest is branchless now.

So we need to limit keystone extension tests as the existing
ones(OS-EC2) for stable branch.

Change-Id: I3a92397d7bc62c3ec156281696d5c22504a86cb3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/81/273381/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
API: Rearrange HTTPBadRequest raising in _resize

This patch aimed to fix AutoDiskConfigDisabledByImage exception is
excpeced for 2 times, besides, rearrange HTTPBadRequest to group them
around each other for easy reading.

P.S. Don't touch any logic so no UT need to be added/changed.

Closes-Bug: #1538411
Change-Id: I2088322681edd4a3190047560ea99d31c5f3a551

revisions:

When calling ensure_path, it will create the key

The ensure_path should not be invoked in this

Change-Id: Ib73828ed71f1ed9fad94b0a323097fa76bb20241
Closes-Bug: #1539355
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ValueError in allocate_unique_key in Zookeeper

When calling ensure_path, it will create the key
without value, which causes ValueError.

The ensure_path should not be invoked in this
function, because the function is able to deal with
NoNodeError.

Change-Id: Ib73828ed71f1ed9fad94b0a323097fa76bb20241
Closes-Bug: #1539355

Keep all tests/subunit artefacts

of files being captured on logs.o.o should contain the
uncompressed version too.

commit_message:
Disable NetworkManager by default

Add the possibility to use NetworkManager or not, but disabled by default.
It is not recommended because it leads to unpredictable behaviour.

Change-Id: I8e080fd5e4ceac9e2e26dafdf50e7f11fb6c8f04
Closes-bug: #1538757

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-15 06:52:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5396d3866d0b0c63dae99d0e03e17bf153d12adc', 'message': "add break in for-loop in unbind_router_servicenode

commit_message:
add return in for-loop in unbind_router_servicenode

Previous method unbind_router_servicenode will return True for
case port related to a router still exists on servicenode. In
that case, it makes no sense not to directly return True, but
keep method running its left part.

This patch will add return to fix details mentioned above, for
that, variable port_found is no longer necessary to use. And
redefine return value, False for notification was not sent case,
which means unbind_router_servicenode should not work successfully,
otherwise return True.

Change-Id: I8d877fb2f73988381a03642b92c3220192089e27

subject: Always fix devices with multiple part-replica assignments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-29 02:46:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/56246cd834b493e8d6a05de96f2405fa92c1be4a', 'message': "Fix rings again

I've found that given a sufficiently bad replica2part2dev table we can
accidently not entirely fix palcement when more than two replicas of a part
are assigned to the duplicate devices.

It shows up most on > 3 replica rings when you have two *different* devices
both holding two replicas.  But you can see it on a three replica ring when
all three replicas are assigned to the same device.

This is WIP - I think I could make a more surgical change with the same effect
and leave some of the cleanup/optomization for a follow on.  Plus, I'm going
to need to hand craft some replica2part2dev tables to demonstrate the issue in
unittests.

I also have an idea that a --no-validate option to rebalance might be a good
escape hatch if you ever anyone else finds a ring that needs multiple
rebalances before it will validate.  I'll probably pull that out to a seperate
change.

Change-Id: Ieb213c1a259815a2ed657291242919cda568c7b5

commit_message:
Always fix devices with multiple part-replica assignments

I've found that given a sufficiently bad replica2part2dev table we can
accidently not entirely fix palcement when more than two replicas of a
part are assigned to the duplicate devices.

It shows up most on > 3 replica rings when you have two *different*
devices both holding two replicas.  But you can see it on a three
replica ring when all three replicas are assigned to the same device.

Change-Id: Ieb213c1a259815a2ed657291242919cda568c7b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/50/273850/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: exit(EXIT_ERROR)

subject: Remove bindings of DVR routers to L3 agents on compute nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-08 15:52:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/abae32965f08f5206dc123ca00fb0b7c6375256b', 'message': 'Improve bindings of DVR routers to L3 agents

As described in the spec there is no need to explicitly bind
DVR router to each l3 agent running on compute nodes where
there are dvr serviceable ports - this brings complexity to the code,
makes it less readable and very hard to maintain (one could see how many
bugs were filed and fixed regarding dvr scheduling stuff already).
Also this brings scalability problems as time needed for router scheduling
grows linearly with the number of compute nodes.

The idea is to align dvr scheduling with legacy router scheduling:
only schedule SNAT portion of the router and use DB queries whenever
we need to know which compute nodes should host the router.

WIP: db migration, tests to be fixed

Implements blueprint improve-dvr-l3-agent-binding

Change-Id: I82c8d256c56bb16cdc1b1232ebb660d09909f9c6
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-22 16:47:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/47f33ca7ee304ba52451ead8a453242f810448f3', 'message': 'Remove bindings of DVR routers to L3 agents on compute nodes

commit_message:
Remove bindings of DVR routers to L3 agents on compute nodes

As described in the spec there is no need to explicitly bind
DVR router to each l3 agent running on compute nodes where
there are dvr serviceable ports - this brings complexity to the code,
makes it less readable and very hard to maintain (one could see how many
bugs were filed and fixed regarding dvr scheduling stuff already).
Also this brings scalability problems as time needed for router scheduling
grows linearly with the number of compute nodes.

The idea is to align dvr scheduling with legacy router scheduling:
only schedule SNAT portion of the router and use DB queries whenever
we need to know which compute nodes should host the router.

Implements blueprint improve-dvr-l3-agent-binding

Change-Id: I82c8d256c56bb16cdc1b1232ebb660d09909f9c6

Overriden for DVR routers to return also hosts where l3 agents in 'dvr' mode are running and where dvr serviceable ports are bound """ state = agentschedulers_db.get_admin_state_up_filter() agents = self.get_l3_agents_hosting_routers( context, [router_id], admin_state_up=state) return [agent.host for agent in agents]

commit_message:
Remove un-used test code

This code has been largely untouched since 2012 and is not wired
up anywhere. This simply removes the file since it is not run
and has not been run for a while.

Change-Id: I67a682bc41d9214a32a24b76b1423828809d1b11

deleted_lines: # Copyright 2012 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import ast from keystone.contrib.admin_crud import core as admin_crud_core from keystone.contrib.s3 import core as s3_core from keystone.contrib.user_crud import core as user_crud_core from keystone.identity import core as identity_core from keystone.version import service class TestSingularPlural(object): def test_keyword_arg_condition_or_methods(self): """Raise if we see a keyword arg called 'condition' or 'methods'.""" modules = [admin_crud_core, s3_core, user_crud_core, identity_core, service] for module in modules: filename = module.__file__ if filename.endswith(".pyc"): # In Python 2, the .py and .pyc files are in the same dir. filename = filename[:-1] with open(filename) as fil: source = fil.read() module = ast.parse(source, filename) last_stmt_or_expr = None for node in ast.walk(module): if isinstance(node, ast.stmt) or isinstance(node, ast.expr): # keyword nodes don't have line numbers, so we need to # get that information from the parent stmt or expr. last_stmt_or_expr = node elif isinstance(node, ast.keyword): for bad_word in ["condition", "methods"]: if node.arg == bad_word: raise AssertionError( "Suspicious name '%s' at %s line %s" % (bad_word, filename, last_stmt_or_expr.lineno))

commit_message:
Update mod_wsgi + cache config docs

I was asked if dogpile.cache.memcached was recommended for Apache httpd
with mod_wsgi because our docs did not make it clear that
dogpile.cache_memcached_pool wasn't necessary. This patch adds an
explicit recommendation.

Along the way, I also cleaned up a few RST formatting issues and
consistently referred to "Apache httpd with ``mod_wsgi``", which is how
Apache *usually* does it themselves (sometimes HTTPD is in all caps, but
it's never a literal like module names are).

Change-Id: Ic562853bacc13f70712e0e61f8aeb8dffc75ab2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/11/271311/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: recommended deployment is to run keystone in a WSGI server such as Apache httpd with ``mod_wsgi``. under eventlet instead of Apache httpd with ``mod_wsgi``. This recommendation is due to known issues with the use of ``thread.local`` under eventlet that can allow the leaking of memcache client objects and consumption of extra sockets. `python-memcached`_ library (recommended for use with Apache httpd with ``mod_wsgi``) * ``keystone.cache.memcache_pool`` - An eventlet-safe implementation of httpd), or behind an SSL terminator. When running Keystone in a web server1. Add the oauth1 driver to the ``[oauth1]`` section in ``keystone.conf``. For example: ``keystone.conf``:3. commit_message:
Add support for Gentoo to source-repositories

As mentioned in package-installs.yaml, git is a transitive dependency
for pbr in this element.  Add pkg-map for the Gentoo package.

Change-Id: I7f2fe1663152ea66b941594e86f1da93ddd21677
Closes-Bug: 1539278

commit_message:
Fix showing network quotas for a project

The OpenStack SDK is now used for the network client. However,
the 'openstack quota show' command wasn't updated for the
client change. As a result, the command will fail to show
network quotas when a project name is specified. For example:

  $ openstack quota show admin
  'Proxy' object has no attribute 'show_quota'

This patch set fixes the command by using the OpenStack SDK
to get network quotas for a project.

Change-Id: I59a7b6780a7b80cd09e79d40d214751b25d3016e
Related-To: blueprint neutron-client
Closes-Bug: #1528249

deleted_lines: network_client = self.app.client_manager.network return network_client.show_quota(parsed_args.project)['quota']

commit_message:
Fix node update will get error if not specify new profile

When update a node name only, will get an error trace in engine
log. This patch fix that problem.

Change-Id: I6988fc3f2b94e3e3bad83cdca30714522c8d7fd8
Closes-Bug: #1540288

commit_message:
Remove incorrectly used "# flake8: noqa"

"# flake8: noqa" option disables all checks for the whole file.
To disable one line we should use "# noqa".
Remove unused "# flake8: noqa" and fix hidden hacking errors.

Change-Id: I624e96784ae7a22b5a5766f38bdf1fb8ade2d0a2
Closes-Bug: #1540254

deleted_lines: import install_venv_common as install_venv # flake8: noqa print help % dict(project=project, venv=venv, root=root)

commit_message:
Baremetal migration

When a baremetal node is broken, it should be migrated into other
redundant node. This feature should also depend on the improvement
in Ironic story which will be implemented by the following Ironic BP.
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/bare-metal-node-n+1-redundancy

And this spec will implement the integration of Ironic and nova about
this feature. i.e. it will meet the step-1 of blueprint
baremetal-migration-evacuation.

Change-Id: I2f6a4e66a7a62b41d66e13f6b9a953d5dd31c76e
Depends-on: I3776dd497e6b1d8cf4f7e59f8663d9d787c8d1f1
Implements: blueprint baremetal-migration-evacuation
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I1939281d844336accb8e7776dddb68a536ef281a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/88/274988/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================== Support migration for Ironic driver ================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/baremetal-migration-evacuation This spec implements migrate() APIs in Ironic driver to migrate baremetals. Problem description =================== Currently, migrate() APIs are not supported in ironic driver. This is because Ironic has not supported baremetal migration. For this reason, we are blocked to provide HA when using Ironic driver in Nova. In Ironic, a BP [1] has been posted. This BP will enable Ironic to switch one baremetal to another when the baremetal is broken. Based on this BP, Nova Ironic driver could call the Ironic API and implement migrate(). The definition of migration in Ironic driver: * migration: Switch one baremetal to another baremetal, the instance on the compute node won't change. This is a little different from libvirt driver, or other VM drivers. Use Cases --------- When a baremetal is broken, we need to do a migration to migrate one baremetal to another, which means boot another baremetal with the same shared volume and use this new baremetal to replace the broken one. In this case, the compute node will still run as before. Proposed change =============== Add an Ironic driver API to migrate a baremetal. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- This spec will implement migrate() APIs in Ironic driver. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Tang Chen (tangchen) Work Items ---------- Implement the migrate() API in Ironic driver. Dependencies ============ This spec depends on the following blueprint in ironic. * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/bare-metal-node-n+1-redundancy Testing ======= Unit tests will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== [1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/bare-metal-node-n+1-redundancy History ======= None

commit_message:
Add Gentoo support to growroot

Add missing growroot initscript and pkg-map entries for Gentoo.

growpart was added to Gentoo with [1]

Update the readme to reflect reality too (fedora added with
I5630dc638f85b1e80795826ef36a306632075460)

[1] https://packages.gentoo.org/packages/sys-fs/growpart

Closes-Bug: #1539273
Change-Id: I29056c7297489ec04f37757dbe33976901eceb49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/69/273769/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/sbin/runscript start() { /usr/local/sbin/growroot eend 0 } depend() { need localmount }

commit_message:
Fix package-installs for python3

subprocess.check_call() returns a byte-string which needs to be turned
into a unicode string for python3 compatability.

Also some minor refactoring while we're here.

Closes-Bug: 1536462
Change-Id: Icd957bc4d93ccad94b1246ad62e6e02ee14d9ca5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/82/273782/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return subprocess.check_output(cmdline).decode(encoding='utf-8') pkg_map_args = ['pkg-map', '--missing-ok', '--element', element, pkg] map_output = ''
deleted_lines: return subprocess.check_output(cmdline) pkg_map_args = ["pkg-map", "--missing-ok", "--element", element] pkg_map_args.append(pkg)

commit_message:
Remove outdated translation files

This repo is not translated by default, so no need to have old
translation files in here that can be regenerated any time.
Remove also the English translation since English is the source
language, there's no need to have an extra translation at all.

Change-Id: I100d7bec0439307ecee5ea977aa6fce2386fa731

commit_message:
log take_action parameters in a single place

Previously each command logs take_action parameters explicitly
by using @utils.log_method decorator or log.debug().
Some commands have no logging.

This commit calls a logger in the base class and
drops all logging definition from individual commands.

Closes-Bug: #1532294
Change-Id: I43cd0290a4353c68c075bade9571c940733da1be

commit_message:
Add Cinder v1 test to gate

e29093f made cinder v2 the default, but didn't change the gate checks
to ensure that we are testing both v2 and v1. This swaps the scenario
that was formerly pinned to v2 to v1 so that we are testing both API
versions.

Change-Id: Ib6d8bbda5185c8aa7886a8d64ebcb96988aae1e7

added_lines: def test_list_role_assignment_does_not_contain_names(self): """Test names are not included with list role assignments Scenario: - names are NOT included when you don't set include_names=True - names are NOT included when include_names=False """ def assert_does_not_contain_names(assignment): first_asgmt_prj = assignment[0] self.assertNotIn('project_name', first_asgmt_prj) self.assertNotIn('project_domain_id', first_asgmt_prj) self.assertNotIn('user_name', first_asgmt_prj) self.assertNotIn('user_domain_id', first_asgmt_prj) self.assertNotIn('role_name', first_asgmt_prj) # Create Refs new_role = unit.new_role_ref() new_domain = self._get_domain_fixture() new_user = unit.new_user_ref(domain_id=new_domain['id']) new_project = unit.new_project_ref(domain_id=new_domain['id']) # Create entities new_role = self.role_api.create_role(new_role['id'], new_role) new_user = self.identity_api.create_user(new_user) self.resource_api.create_project(new_project['id'], new_project) self.assignment_api.create_grant(user_id=new_user['id'], project_id=new_project['id'], role_id=new_role['id']) # Get the created assignments with NO include_names flag _asgmt_prj = self.assignment_api.list_role_assignments( user_id=new_user['id'], project_id=new_project['id']) assert_does_not_contain_names(_asgmt_prj) # Get the created assignments with include_names=False _asgmt_prj = self.assignment_api.list_role_assignments( user_id=new_user['id'], project_id=new_project['id'], include_names=False) assert_does_not_contain_names(_asgmt_prj)

commit_message:
Make test suite backward compat with identity v2

The default was changed to V3 identity API in devstack, so we updated
our test suite.  Thats now been reverted. This updatesthe test suite
to be backward compat. with V2.

Change-Id: Iaae0bfa2d2ca09f426dba559c4d319b73b724b2d

subject: Add POST method for creating pools and flavors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 01:58:43.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/post-method-pools-flavors.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar-specs/commit/d31ed8c498bbf21b01fb26b5b137dd560a1e9dfb', 'message': "Add POST method for creating pools and flavors

For now the only way to create a pool or flavor is to use PUT method,
which can accidentally update the existing pool or flavor.
If we implement HTTP POST method for creating pools and flavors, the
user who doesn't want to accidentally overwrite the existing resource,
would be able to use POST method instead of PUT method.

Change-Id: I168d72220d79c3046dce3b0e36b24967d57083d5
Implements: blueprint post-method-pools-flavors
"}]
commit_message:
Add POST method for creating pools and flavors

For now the only way to create a pool or flavor is to use PUT method,
which can accidentally update the existing pool or flavor.
If we implement HTTP POST method for creating pools and flavors, the
user who doesn't want to accidentally overwrite the existing resource,
would be able to use POST method instead of PUT method.

Change-Id: I168d72220d79c3046dce3b0e36b24967d57083d5
Implements: blueprint post-method-pools-flavors
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar-specs refs/changes/68/274968/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zaqar/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst. Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ============================================== Add POST method for creating pools and flavors ============================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zaqar/+spec/post-method-pools-flavors Add POST method for creating pools and flavors. Problem description =================== For now the only way to create a pool or flavor in Zaqar is to use HTTP PUT method in request, which can accidentally update an existing pool or flavor. There is no no way to know from the response, was the resource created or just updated, in both cases the response code is ``201``. So now the user, who don't want to overwrite something while using PUT method, is forced first to check the resource existence by using GET method. At the same time, the way the PUT method currently works in Zaqar is correct. See `HTTP Guidelines for HTTP-methods`_. Proposed change =============== We can add HTTP POST method for pools and flavors in our API v1.1 and API v2. (API v1 doesn't provide support pools and flavors functionality). The response for POST method request will return ``201`` status code, if the resource was successfully created and ``409`` status code, if the resource already exists. With POST method available, the user would be able to create pools and flavors safely and without additional checking. Backward compatibility ---------------------- The change is fully backward compatible with our APIs, however, changes like this are recommended to be made as API extensions. See `Evaluating API changes`_. Drawbacks --------- It is recommended to make this change as API extension. See `Evaluating API changes`_. In case we follow this recommendation, we have to make API extension, which is not welcomed now. In case we do not follow this recommendation, it's bad itself. Alternatives ------------ The alternative is to change the existing HTTP PUT method to return ``409`` status code, if the resource already exists, which was proposed by the `HTTP PUT specification currently under review`_. However, it will change the idempotent nature of PUT method. And our PUT method will no longer match the definition of PUT method. See `HTTP Guidelines for HTTP-methods`_. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ubershy Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Mitaka-3 Work Items ---------- 1. Add POST method to API v1.1 and API v2 for pools and flavors. 2. To make it possible, If needed, modify storage controller methods. Dependencies ============ None .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. _HTTP Guidelines for HTTP-methods: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/http.html#http-methods .. _Evaluating API changes: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/evaluating_api_changes.html .. _The upcoming change for the client: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/266822/ .. _HTTP PUT specification currently under review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246147/

subject: Add msec resolution to ovn-northd console logs.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-01 20:15:13.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/b4802b61b8437edce15a7faa0e56f01071b11e08', 'message': 'Add msec resolution to ovn-northd console logs.

Now that ovn-northd logs to the console for screen, add the pattern

Change-Id: I84be5147dca54905296fafe14c81b9a949e6e166
Signed-off-by: RYAN D. MOATS <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add msec resolution to ovn-northd console logs.

Now that ovn-northd logs to the console for screen, add the pattern
that sets the log timestamp resolution to include milliseconds.

Change-Id: I84be5147dca54905296fafe14c81b9a949e6e166
Signed-off-by: RYAN D. MOATS <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/76/274876/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This makes sure that the console logs have time stamps to # the millisecond, but we need to make sure ovs-appctl has # a pid file to work with, so ... echo -n "Waiting for ovn-northd to start ... " while ! test -e /usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovn-northd.pid ; do sleep 1 done echo "done." sudo ovs-appctl -t ovn-northd vlog/set "PATTERN:CONSOLE:%D{%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.###Z}|%05N|%c%T|%p|%m"

commit_message:
Bandit profile updates

We'd like to use the same "gate" profile for all OpenStack gate jobs,
so the "keystone_conservative" profile which we were running as part
of the gate is change to "gate.

The other profiles that aren't used as part of the gate are removed.

Change-Id: I931dc957b4659806027d45dfec5e61e9c7973564
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/10/267810/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = bandit -c bandit.yaml -r keystoneclient -n5 -p gate
deleted_lines: commands = bandit -c bandit.yaml -r keystoneclient -n5 -p keystone_conservative

commit_message:
Refactor parts of failure resolving/handling

Instead of having the completer also contain the
strategy resolving logic have it instead just have a
mapping of outcomes -> failure resolvers and have those
failure resolvers do the work of actually resolving
any failures that occur.

It also removes the double isinstance check and
handling of failures by using the already existing
isinstance check to call into different completion
methods (one for failures and one for not).

Change-Id: I71ee3068ce6b33c88a6596b60260a28d4fa87872
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/78/266078/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class StrategyResolver(object): """Resolver that resolves by analyzing retries and applying strategies.""" def __call__(self, atom, failure): # We attempted to resolve this, so we can discard the failure # that causes this to be invoked. return False class Completer(object): """Completes atoms using actions/failure resolvers to complete them.""" def __init__(self, runtime): self._runtime = weakref.proxy(runtime) self._analyzer = runtime.analyzer self._storage = runtime.storage self._failure_resolvers = { ex.EXECUTED: StrategyResolver(runtime), # Reverting failed, always retain the failure... ex.REVERTED: lambda _atom, _failure: True } def resume(self): """Resumes atoms in the contained graph. This is done to allow any previously completed or failed atoms to be analyzed, there results processed and any potential atoms affected to be adjusted as needed. This should return a set of atoms which should be the initial set of atoms that were previously not finished (due to a RUNNING or REVERTING attempt not previously finishing). """ atoms = list(self._analyzer.iterate_nodes(co.ATOMS)) atom_states = self._storage.get_atoms_states(atom.name for atom in atoms) for atom in atoms: atom_state, _atom_intention = atom_states[atom.name] if atom_state == st.FAILURE: resolver = self._failure_resolvers[ex.EXECUTED] resolver(atom, self._storage.get(atom.name)) for retry in self._analyzer.iterate_retries(st.RETRYING): for atom, state, intention in self._runtime.retry_subflow(retry): if state: atom_states[atom.name] = (state, intention) unfinished_atoms = set() for atom in atoms: atom_state, _atom_intention = atom_states[atom.name] if atom_state in (st.RUNNING, st.REVERTING): unfinished_atoms.add(atom) return unfinished_atoms def complete(self, node, outcome, result): """Performs post-execution completion of a node. Returns whether the result should be saved into an accumulator of failures or whether this should not be done. """ handler = self._runtime.fetch_action(node) if outcome == ex.EXECUTED: handler.complete_execution(node, result) else: handler.complete_reversion(node, result) if isinstance(result, failure.Failure): resolver = self._failure_resolvers[outcome] return resolver(node, result) else: return False

commit_message:
Separate microversion test case related unit tests

This patch just separate the unit tests which are related to microversion
test cases logic and set/unset config values.

This is needed to migrate api_version_utils to lib with its unit tests.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions-testing-support

Change-Id: Ie23ad006605882ab3e85e3d307a4f728231083cf

commit_message:
remove unnecessary message when running unit test

When we test log related code, we still print the tested log message
into stderr, which is not quite useful for developers, we should
mock those message. Package fixtures.FakeLogger already provides an
option to mock specified logger, so let's use it.

Note: this patch also changes an unnecessary object attribute to local
varible.

Change-Id: I4bc5beaa4eba149f12c58f072fe66163aed8c0c8
Closes-Bug: #1500236

commit_message:
Skip centos functional testing

Due to upstream bug [1] there are uninstallable packages which mean
our functional tests don't work.  We will revert this when things are
working upstream.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1303660

Change-Id: I93c2990472e88ab3e5ff14db56b4ff1b4dd965ef

commit_message:
Spec for trust

Some services which are running in a bay need to access OpenStack
services. In order to access OpenStack services, we can create a
trustee for each bay and delegate a limited set of rights to the
trustee.

Partially-Implements: blueprint create-trustee-user-for-each-bay
Change-Id: Ifbb5b536201a6f65038be94118b36e6033b88512
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/52/268852/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================= Create a trustee for each bay ============================= Some services which are running in a bay need to access OpenStack services. For example, Kubernetes load balancer [1]_ needs to access Neutron. Docker registry [2]_ needs to access Swift. In order to access OpenStack services, we can create a trustee for each bay and delegate a limited set of rights to the trustee. [3]_ and [4]_ give a brief introduction to Keystone's trusts mechanism. Proposed change =============== When a user (the "trustor") wants to create a bay, steps for trust are as follows. 1. Create a user (the "trustee") without any role in a domain which is dedicated for trust. Without any role, the user can do nothing in Openstack. 2. Define a trust relationship between the trustor and the trustee. The trustor can delegate a limited set of roles to the trustee. 3. Services in the vm can access OpenStack services with the trustee credentials and the trust. Trustee id, trustee password and trust id are stored in magnum database. The roles which are delegated to the trustee should be limited. If the services in the bay only need access to Neutron, we should not allow the services to access to other OpenStack services. But there is a problem here. When a trustor delegate a role to a trustee, the trustor must have the role. An user only with admin role can access all the OpenStack services, but the user can not delegate a role which is limited to access Swift to a trustee. So if the user want to create a bay, he should have the roles which are delegated to the trustee. References ========== [1] `http://docs.openstack.org/developer/magnum/dev/dev-kubernetes-load-balancer.html`_ [2] `https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/registryv2-in-master`_ [3] `http://blogs.rdoproject.org/5858/role-delegation-in-keystone-trusts`_ [4] `https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Keystone/Trusts`_

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/37/273337/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > Methods in manager classes and resource classes return wrapper classes that wrap values returned originally. For example, a wrapper class for list, a wrapper class for dict, a wrapper class for str and so on. The wrapper classes have the request IDs property that is returned from Nova(nova-api). So the caller can get the callee(Nova)'s request IDs, then output them to logs with its own request ID. The function to output them to the logs will be implemented in other projects(cinder, heat, etc.). features: - Methods in manager classes and resource classes return wrapper classes that wrap values returned originally. For example, a wrapper class for list, a wrapper class for dict, a wrapper class for str and so on. The wrapper classes have the request IDs property that is returned from Nova(nova-api). So the caller can get the callee(Nova)'s request IDs, then output them to logs with its own request ID. The function to output them to the logs will be implemented in other projects(cinder, heat, etc.). upgrade: - In case that methods return a response object and body originally and body is None, the methods return the wrapper class for tuple as 'body' instead of the wrapper class for None. The wrapper class for None has not been added.

commit_message:
Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)

The usage of assertEqual(True/False, ***) should be changed
to a meaningful format of assertTrue/False(***).

Change-Id: I07839e9cfafe6a978dc7fbedf583b8caf6fec529
Closes-Bug:#1512207
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/30/264230/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: code = "self.assertEqual(True, a in b)" code = "self.assertEqual(True, 'str' in 'string')" code = "self.assertEqual(True, any(a==1 for a in b))" code = "self.assertEqual(False, a in b)" code = "self.assertEqual(False, 'str' in 'string')" code = "self.assertEqual(False, any(a==1 for a in b))" code = "self.assertEqual(None, A)" code = "self.assertEqual(True, A)" code = "self.assertEqual(False, A)"

commit_message:
Add conductor manager to handle all RPC handler

This patch introduces a new class ConductorManager which will be in charge
for the RPC_API_VERSION controller.

We have plan to make some of rpc calling method to use async mode, this patch
will be the preparation for doing that.

Partially implements: blueprint versioning-rpc-server
Change-Id: I067648ba3ad46f34f60a8c806df0ccc361e39b0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/08/247308/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: server = rpc_service.Service.create('magnum-conductor', 'magnum.conductor.manager', 'ConductorManager')
deleted_lines: from magnum.common import short_id from magnum.conductor.handlers import bay_conductor from magnum.conductor.handlers import ca_conductor from magnum.conductor.handlers import conductor_listener from magnum.conductor.handlers import docker_conductor from magnum.conductor.handlers import indirection_api from magnum.conductor.handlers import k8s_conductor from magnum.conductor.handlers import x509keypair_conductor cfg.CONF.import_opt('topic', 'magnum.conductor.config', group='conductor') conductor_id = short_id.generate_id() endpoints = [ indirection_api.Handler(), docker_conductor.Handler(), k8s_conductor.Handler(), bay_conductor.Handler(), x509keypair_conductor.Handler(), conductor_listener.Handler(), ca_conductor.Handler(), ] server = rpc_service.Service.create(cfg.CONF.conductor.topic, conductor_id, endpoints, binary='magnum-conductor')

commit_message:
allow DHCP from router interfaces

This fix adds the router interfaces as allowed source addresses for
DHCP. This supports the Astara appliance case where DHCP is running
within the same appliance providing routing.

Backported from commit 1b3e6dd1a5336009c274083c2a25c2285d379e6

Change-Id: Ic4db49dc39a524b6c1557b9423496a1eb5d87843
Closes-Bug:1531967
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/astara-neutron refs/changes/69/272269/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.db import models_v2 def _select_dhcp_ips_for_network_ids(self, context, network_ids): ips = super(Ml2Plugin, self)._select_dhcp_ips_for_network_ids( context, network_ids ) # allow DHCP replies from router interfaces since they're combined in # Astara appliances. Minimal impact if another appliance is used. query = context.session.query(models_v2.Port.mac_address, models_v2.Port.network_id, models_v2.IPAllocation.ip_address) query = query.join(models_v2.IPAllocation) query = query.filter(models_v2.Port.network_id.in_(network_ids)) owner = neutron_constants.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF query = query.filter(models_v2.Port.device_owner == owner) for mac_address, network_id, ip in query: if (netaddr.IPAddress(ip).version == 6 and not netaddr.IPAddress(ip).is_link_local()): ip = str(netaddr.EUI(mac_address).ipv6_link_local()) if ip not in ips[network_id]: ips[network_id].append(ip) return ips

commit_message:
Pass network_id to ML2 type drivers.

This patch enhances the call to Type Drivers to include network ID.

This gives flexibility to vendors (writing their own type drivers)
to group the allocations based upon the networks - or associate
resources with the networks.

Change-Id: I0a7ca370004dbbe86027dacc4a6c968fcf0c7273
Closes-Bug: 1524576

commit_message:
fix locking in ceilometer

there are quite a few things wrong with current implementation.
- pop doesn't call __delitem__. not sure why but basically it's not
getting called. ever.
- cannot set blocking=False when using contextmanager. blocking=False
can only be done by calling acquire(False)

this fixes both cases above so now locks are actually deleted.

Change-Id: I171862815ee3abe8c10441bdb85ff7c1ee547ed0

deleted_lines: with self.__getitem__(key)(blocking=False):

added_lines: # desc "Task to load list of modules to skip" task :load_skip_file, :skip_file do |t, args| $skip_module_list = [] # TODO(aschultz): Fix all modules so they have tests and we no longer need # this file to exclude bad module tests if not args[:skip_file].nil? and File.exists?(args[:skip_file]) File.open(args[:skip_file], 'r').each_line { |line| $skip_module_list << line.chomp } end end Rake::Task["common:load_skip_file"].invoke(args[:skip_file]) $stderr.puts '-'*80 $stderr.puts "Git changes found! Build modules list..." $stderr.puts '-'*80 if $skip_module_list.include?(File.basename(mod.chomp)) $stderr.puts "Skipping tests... modules.disable_rspec includes #{mod}" next end Rake::Task["common:load_skip_file"].invoke(args[:skip_file]) if $skip_module_list.include?(File.basename(mod))
deleted_lines: skip_module_list = [] # TODO(aschultz): Fix all modules so they have tests and we no longer need # this file to exclude bad module tests if not args[:skip_file].nil? and File.exists?(args[:skip_file]) File.open(args[:skip_file], 'r').each_line { |line| skip_module_list << line.chomp } end if skip_module_list.include?(File.basename(mod))

commit_message:
Replace unicode with six.text_type

The Unicode type is 'unicode' in Python 2 and 'str' on Python 3.
This patch replaces unicode with six.text_type to make Keystone
compatible with Python 2 and Python 3. To protect against regression
two py34 problems were fixed and test_middleware.py was added
to tox.ini.

Co-Authored-By: Tom Cocozzello <tjcocozz@us.ibm.com>
bp python3
Change-Id: I4a5cf86ca1aa5f4d305696c2b39cdbc7e2cbc71e

commit_message:
Move rabbit conf settings to separate section

oslo.messaging has deprecated the use of messaging config settings,
specifically rabbit_* settings, in the [DEFAULT] section. This commit
moves the rabbit settings to a [oslo_messaging_rabbit] section in
each of the relevant trove service sample config files.

Change-Id: Ia869768102a8a841313cd7e0fd8a9fdab257d3e3
Closes-Bug: #1528391

Configure docker registry in devstack when swift is enabled.

commit_message:
Add fixed_subnet to Baymodel Object

In current Magnum code, Baymodel's 'fixed_network' is mapped to heat's
'fixed_network_cidr'. So 'fixed_network' actually means 'fixed_network_cidr',
or more precisely 'fixed_subnet'. For heat stack creation, it need
create a new fixed network and fixed subnet. So, give 'fixed_network'
the role it should be, and add a new field 'fixed_subnet' to Baymodel,
and then use 'fixed_subnet' to take the place of current 'fixed_network'.
This patch add fixed_subnet in Baymodel to support this.

Change-Id: Ia74ed924b3058b4891775f34f1b9624774c02ddb
Partial-Bug: #1519748

commit_message:
Raise exception when Bay Failed

Raise a BayException when Bay create/update/delete failed with
detail status and failure reason. This make more louder noises when
error occurred, so it's more easier for users to locate them.

Change-Id: I521261906e60727f8f25d6f3f38ded26c0988c81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/55/257455/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class BayFailed(MagnumException): message = _("Bay %(status)s because of %(reason).")

Add docker-bootstrap for etcd, flannel, k8s containerization.

Partially implements: blueprint run-kube-as-container

commit_message:
Add registry_address to bay db and api

User can know the docker registry url by registry_address. When a user
want to pull or push a image from registry, he should add the
registry_address before the image name and tag like
docker pull ${registry_name}/${image_name}:${image_tag}
docker push ${registry_name}/${image_name}:${image_tag}.

Partially-Implements: blueprint registryv2-in-master
Change-Id: I4eca109e749e6d872f099e82b52aadcbe27de74c
